message_1: In how many ways can a committee of 3 people be formed from a group of 7 people?
message_2:
To form a committee of 3 people from a group of 7 people, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (7 in this case), k is the number of people to choose (3 in this case), and ! denotes the factorial function (e.g., 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1).

Using the combination formula, we can calculate the number of ways to form the committee:

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!(7-3)!)
= 7! / (3!4!)
= (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))
= (7 × 6 × 5) / (3 × 2 × 1)
= 210 / 6
= 35

So there are 35 ways to form a committee of 3 people from a group of 7 people.
